newsitem.title: USA: EXEL to acquire rest of GCR for $637.2 million.
newsitem.headline: EXEL to acquire rest of GCR for $637.2 million.

text.p: Exel Ltd. said Thursday it agreed to acquire the remaining publicly held shares of reinsurer GCR Holdings Ltd. that it does not already own for $27.00 per share in cash, or $637.2 million.
Exel said it will start a cash tender offer for the 23.6 million outstanding GCR shares no later than May 14. It now owns 1.2 million, or 4.9 percent, of GCR's 24.8 million shares outstanding.
GCR's stock closed Wednesday at $22.375 on Nasdaq. Exel was unchanged at $39.625 early on the New York Stock Exchange.
Exel said the merger of the two companies should boost 1997 earnings and increase shareholder value.
The offer has been unanimously approved by both companies' boards directors and is subject to the tender of at least 75 percent of GCR's shares.

GCR, based in Hamilton, Bermuda, provides property catastrophe, property risk excess-of-loss, property pro rata, marine, energy, satellite and financial products reinsurance worldwide through its Global Capital Reinsurance Ltd. subsidiary.

Exel, also based in Bermuda, is a leading provider of general liability, directors and officers liability, employment practices and professional liability, excess property insurance and reinsurance worldwide.
